subject: Re: [junit] PrivateAccessor - Failed static method invocation?
msgSnippet: Hi! Not sure this has been answered.. This message you are seeing is because doSomething is not a static method. You need to create an object of this call and
messageBody:
Hi!

Not sure this has been answered..

This message you are seeing is because doSomething is not a static
method. You need to create an object of this call and pass this
reference instead of MyClass.Class.

Regards,
Nagendra


leephilipreilly wrote:

> Hi folks,
>
> I've been unit testing for a while now, but have only delved into
> all of the addons just recently. I've read a couple of articles on
> testing private methods, and I figure that the PrivateAccessor class
> may help. I've been trying to get it to work, but I keep running
> into a `Failed static method invocation` exception. Google,
> strangely, gives me zero hits :-(
>
> If anyone could spare a few minutes and perhaps give me a rough idea
> of what the problem is, I'd appreciate it...
>
> I have the following method:
>
> private void doSomething(Long someValue, String anotherValue) throws
> SomeException
> {
> ...
> }
>
> I'm my test, I do something like:
>
> try {
> PrivateAccessor.invoke(
> MyClass.class,
> "doSomething",
> new Class[] {Long.class,String.class },
> new Object[] {someValue, anotherValue});
> }
>
> catch (Throwable t) {
> System.out.println(t.getMessage());
> }
>
> Many thanks in advance for any replies.
>
> - Best regards,
>
> L
>
>
